content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Iron Smelting Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0)
Consists of: Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0)  
Use-case: Smelts iron ore with coal to produce additional iron plates needed for higher‐tier production (e.g. as ingredients for Lab crafting).

### Copper Smelting Furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)
Consists of: Furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)  
Use-case: Converts harvested copper ore into copper plates required for producing copper cables and downstream components.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Errors in get_entities Usage  
  – Avoid using unsupported keyword arguments (such as “radius”) or extraneous positional arguments when calling get_entities. Verify the API’s signature so that calls match its expected parameters.

• None Iteration Error  
  – When filtering entities (for example, iterating over labs), ensure that the returned value is a valid iterable rather than None. Incorporate proper checks before processing the results.

• Lab Placement Failures  
  – Before attempting to place a Lab at a given position, confirm that a Lab is available in the inventory. This prevents errors related to trying to place non-existent items.

• Lab Crafting Supply Chain Shortfalls  
  – Repeated crafting errors for Lab production indicate missing sub-ingredients (for instance, iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, copper-cables). Ensure that all prerequisite smelting and crafting processes are complete and that sufficient resources are available to satisfy the full bill of materials before initiating Lab production.
